definition: abbr. for Heilongjiang province 黑龍江|黑龙江[Hei1 long2 jiang1]
cave/hole/zero (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers)/CL:個|个[ge4]
cave/hole/zero (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers)/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Two doors along, a rubric stood out from the tenebrous gloom.
sentences.chinese: 走過兩扇門，黑洞洞的幽暗中顯現出注目的題目。

sentences.english: His eyes looking at the dark ceiling, not a little sleepy.
sentences.chinese: 睜着眼望着黑洞洞的天花板，沒有一點睡意。

sentences.english: She shivered at the thought of going into the dark house alone.
sentences.chinese: 她想到要獨自走進那所黑洞洞的房子裏去就不寒而慄。

sentences.english: I grope for the light switch in the dark room.
sentences.chinese: 我在黑洞洞的屋裏摸索著尋找電燈開關。

sentences.english: He shivered at the thought of going into dark house alone.
sentences.chinese: 他想到要獨自走進那所黑洞洞的房子就不寒而慄。

sentences.english: Do not approach in a dark alley.
sentences.chinese: 不要靠近黑洞洞的巷子。

sentences.english: Between its sand-filled eyes was a black hole.
sentences.chinese: 眼睛灌滿了沙土，成了黑洞洞。

sentences.english: The kitchen now is a dark cavern, with an antiquated black stove in a corner.
sentences.chinese: 廚房現在黑洞洞的，角落裏有隻破舊的黑色爐子。

definition: variant of 黑糊糊[hei1 hu1 hu1]
variant of 黑糊糊[hei1 hu1 hu1]
pitch-black/(fig.) to be completely in the dark
bloody mouth wide open like a sacrificial bowl (idiom); ferocious mouth of beast of prey/fig. greedy exploiter/rapacious aggressor
pitch-black/(fig.) to be completely in the dark
